body:
@lhyundeadsoul I added the two lines and ran the command `docker-compose up`. Still I'm getting the  error.
Do I need to again run some installation steps ?

In fact there's a new error also.
`Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/flask/_compat.py", line 35, in reraise
    raise value
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/flask/cli.py", line 95, in find_best_app
    module=module.__name__
flask.cli.NoAppException: Failed to find Flask application or factory in module "app". Use "FLASK_APP=app:name to specify one.`

My docker-entrypoint.sh file looks something like this
```bash
#!/bin/bash
set -ex

if [ "$#" -ne 0 ]; then
    exec "$@"
elif [ "$SUPERSET_ENV" = "development" ]; then
    superset worker &
    # needed by superset runserver
    (cd superset/assets/ && yarn && yarn run sync-backend)
    (cd superset/assets/ && yarn run dev) &
    export FLASK_APP=superset
    export FLASK_ENV=development
    flask run -p 8088 --with-threads --reload --debugger --host=0.0.0.0
elif [ "$SUPERSET_ENV" = "production" ]; then
    superset worker &
    superset runserver -a 0.0.0.0 -w $((2 * $(getconf _NPROCESSORS_ONLN) + 1))
else
    superset --help
fi
```
Possibly related, I started seeing (ir)regular with latest master

I believe this relates to this recent PR:

https://github.com/apache/incubator-superset/pull/6430

As an intermediate hack, you can see that the URL for a chart contains it's Parameters, which you can edit directly on the address bar:

https://address/superset/explore/?form_data={"datasource"%3A"21__table"...}

For some reason, editing this field on the Edit Chart doesn't seem to work.

By changing the table ID, the chart's datasource will change accordingly.

这个问题一直都存在，有另外一种解决办法，你可以先保存查询，然后再去数据表中找到你保存的查询进行可视化，记得取消勾选不等于SQL视图。
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33197465/50266554-f11a9980-045e-11e9-89d3-feb466590ba6.png)
@SevenDL I just tried and it seems that saved query does not appear in the List Tables view. (刚刚试了，已保存查询不在数据表的列表之中)
![superset](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7379436/50278620-cb35ca80-0447-11e9-8dd7-5e8b9cc0ca41.PNG)

抱歉我记错了，是点击了“可视化”的表格才是我说的那种流程。
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33197465/50279394-854b2780-0484-11e9-973d-a8f4e482851a.png)

但是我刚刚又找到了另外一个解决办法：编辑SQL的时候先不把字段重命名成中文，可视化后按上述流程找到表，先在Detail中把表的SQL语句换成你想重命名的，再在List Column中把字段名称改成你重命名后的，就可以进行可视化了。亲测可行，但是挺麻烦的。
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33197465/50279435-9dbb4200-0484-11e9-9410-07384050f6f6.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33197465/50279478-b7f52000-0484-11e9-95d0-10089cdfc781.png)

Same problem here, docker based installation.

@sushan-upadhyay , @krdeepak 
Are you guys sure you rebuilt docker without a cache and not just pop it up from docker images?
`sudo docker-compose build --no-cache superset` - should do the job, but to be 100% sure do also 
try `docker rm` on the container, `docker rmi` on the image

Thank you very much. It works. And I find edit the verbose name can do it too. 
非常感谢。另外，我发现修改全称也可以做到。

Still present in 0.29. It is caused by this commit
https://github.com/apache/incubator-superset/commit/0ec9cd4ad279c24b6d65fb825a319357958297fd

Basically datetime date field gets formatted by BaseViz.json_dumps that uses json_int_dttm_ser serializer which turns date into epoch.

@mistercrunch I guess that commit fixed non grouped options, but in turn broke grouped. 
What happens if one would only do
```python
    def json_dumps(self, obj, sort_keys=False):
        return json.dumps(
            obj,
            default=utils.json_iso_dttm_ser,
            sort_keys=sort_keys,
            ignore_nan=True
        )
```
in tableviz ?

Actual source for that documentation has been corrected (https://github.com/apache/incubator-superset/blob/master/docs/installation.rst#user-content-start-with-docker) but it hasn't been updated to superset.incubator.apache.org yet
Documentation has been updated (https://github.com/apache/incubator-superset/blob/master/docs/installation.rst#user-content-start-with-docker) but the actual page hasn't been updated yet

```
warning package-lock.json found. Your project contains lock files generated by tools other than Yarn. It is advised not to mix package managers in order to avoid resolution inconsistencies caused by unsynchronized lock files. To clear this warning, remove package-lock.json.
```

You essentially need to fork and make your own builds.

This is a good place to start: 
https://github.com/apache/incubator-superset/blob/master/superset/assets/stylesheets/less/cosmo/variables.less

We serve a display page for the theme you can use while you tweak it: `/superset/theme/`

@betodealmeida mind taking a look?
@betodealmeida @hughhhh
@betodealmeida @hughhhh

The current "Explore" implementation brings your query as a view in the "explore view", and runs queries on top your query as a subquery. Since Druid does not support subqueries, this approach does not work.

We're starting work to add support for charts directly inside SQL Lab.
We decided that `setup.py` offers version ranges, and to use `pip-tools` / `pip-compile` to generate `requirements.txt`.

Awesome, happy to see this getting some love! :)

Hello all, sorry for such a tardy follow-up on this but I've updated the design of this feature as we've discussed. The concerns I kept in mind are:
~ The weight of the action should be reflected in the prominence of the indicator / toggle
~ Changing the status shouldn't be buried in a drop-down
~ It should be clear what a dashboard having a particular status means to new users

The main ways I've alleviated these issues are:
~ The indicator / toggle is next to the title making it nigh impossible to miss
~ There is no option for publishing in the dropdown, one must use the status toggle (which also always surfaces the tooltip)
~ Tooltips are provided which explain what these terms mean and how to interact with it. (For instance prompting clicking the button to toggle it or encouraging users to favorite it if they wish to see it in their list of dashboards)

the mechanics still work the same (admin can see all dashboards, users can see dashboards they've favorited, etc). The description provided by @sylvia-tomiyama a few comments back hits the nail on the head.

The new design moves the toggle between the title of the dashboard and the favorite star – this way the user can do all they need to with the dashboard in regards to publishing in one place:

1. See the status clearly displayed
2. Toggle the status (if permitted)
3. Favorite the dashboard if they wish to (due to it being a draft and wanting to access it later) 

## **For a draft (unpublished) dashboard**

### _As the owner_

This badge is no longer just a badge but actually a `<button>` tag so that the user can toggle the status. It then says "Published" as you can see in a couple images.
![image](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Tresdon/misc_public/master/images/superset/draft_as_admin.png)

### _As another_

This badge is not clickable since the user does not have edit rights on the dashboard. It is just a `<div>` tag
![image](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Tresdon/misc_public/master/images/superset/draft_as_gamma.png)

## **For a published dashboard**

### _As the owner_

This is a  <button> which will toggle back to being a draft if clicked. Same as above. I didn't get it in the image but it has the tooltip:
> This dashboard is published. Click to make it a draft.

![image](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Tresdon/misc_public/master/images/superset/published_as_admin.png)

### _As another_

Nothing shows up for this user since it's a published dashboard.
![image](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Tresdon/misc_public/master/images/superset/published_as_gamma.png)

## To summarize:
Those with permissions to edit the dashboard will always see a `<button>` which specifies the current state of the dashboard and allows them to toggle it.

Those who are just visiting the dashboard will see a non-clickable (`<div>`) "Draft" badge if it is a draft else they will see nothing.

I think this addresses the main concerns we were discussing but would love to get some feedback from @elibrumbaugh and any other folks who may be relevant so that we might be able to move forward on this.

Hope everyone's holiday season is great!
Could you please point out(refer me) to the changes you did in the code for the dashboard permissions ?
Tweaked the verbiage for some of these options

@thinmatt can we put some thought into where those buttons should be placed if within the SQL editor panel? ie. usually action buttons are in the lower right. also, SQL queries tend to be more vertical than wide, so gives more usable real estate for the SQL query if it's over in the lower right. thoughts on why parameters is over there vs. with the other ones?
i'm not sure how i feel about the buttons being in the editor itself, but i think it's because it's something i'm not used to. not against, but may take some time to sink in
Another idea I had was to support multi-columns eventually. That'd be how we'd support "cascading dropdowns" , powered by a single query.

To fix CI you'll have to `npm install --save react-hotkeys` or equivalent to get the `package-lock.json` to be in sync (we've merged the PR deprecating `yarn`)
So now that we are enhancing, is exposing redis and psql ports a needed feature? (6379:6379 and 5432:5432)
No, I don’t think so. You would want those apps to run in separate containers.

I don't think exposing ports to the host has anything to do with separating
services in containers.

Currently they are in separate containers and see each other through the
private network created by docker-compose.

If the ports are exposed to the host, it can be helpful for debugging
purpose. This compose file and docker image are here for development, so it
makes sense to expose the ports.

> I got this working. I added the following 3 parameters
> 
> `AUTH_USER_REGISTRATION = True`
> `AUTH_ROLE_PUBLIC = 'Public'`
> `AUTH_USER_REGISTRATION_ROLE = 'Public'`
> 
> Superset config specifically needs the user registration as True for any user that logs in the first time. Closing this issue now.

I am facing the sam issue. But I cannot resolve the problem by adding the 3 params.

number and time formatting has been migrated to latest `d3` micro packages. Many places in the code has also been updated. Only some old `d3` v3 usage remains in the visualization code.         #'P1Y': "TRUNC(TO_DATE({col}), 'YEAR')",
    #}
    time_grain_functions = {
        None: '{col}',
        'PT1S': 'CAST({col} as DATE)',
        'PT1M': "TRUNC(cast({col} as date), 'MI')",
        'PT1H': "TRUNC(cast({col} as date), 'HH')",
        'P1D': "TRUNC(cast({col} as date), 'DDD')",
        'P1W': "TRUNC(cast({col} as date), 'WW')",
        'P1M': "TRUNC(cast({col} as date), 'MONTH')",
        'P0.25Y': "TRUNC(cast({col} as date), 'Q')",
        'P1Y': "TRUNC(cast({col} as date), 'YEAR')",
    }

The commented part is the "current" code. The non-commented is my modification. It makes it work in my case.

This should be fine then.
